title: Apple, Intel, Tesla, Levi Strauss: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today; Apple results are due after the close; Intel's earnings were down amid a spending uptick
text:
* Shares of Tesla edged up 0.7% premarket after Elon Musk said the electric-car maker won't introduce new models this year, as it bets on increasing deliveries over diversifying its product offerings in the face of ongoing supply-chain disruptions.

* Apparel company Levi Strauss said it expects higher revenue in 2022 than the previous year and reported higher profit in the fourth quarter. Shares rose more than 7% premarket.

* Shares of Whirlpool added 1.3% premarket after the company said that washing machines, refrigerators and other appliances are likely to remain hard to get this year as Covid-19 infections continue to fuel supply chain problems.

* Shares of digital lending company LendingClub fell almost 20% premarket after the company gave 2022 earnings guidance lower than analysts expected.

* Teradyne's first-quarter financial guidance fell short of Wall Street projections, sending shares down 20% premarket.

* Las Vegas Sands reported lower losses but a slight decline in revenue in the fourth quarter. Shares gained 1.3% premarket.

* Xilinx shares added 7.5% premarket after it said its board approved a special dividend that will only be payable if the company's previously announced merger with Advanced Micro Devices isn't closed by the record date of the dividend.

* Blackstone's net income nearly doubled in the fourth quarter thanks to strong investment performance in some of its biggest businesses, as the largest private-equity firm by assets raked in more cash than in any other period in its history. Shares added about 6% premarket.

* Shares of McDonald's fell 2.4% premarket after the fast-food chain reported fourth-quarter earnings and revenue that missed expectations.

* Mastercard shares edged down 0.8% despite the credit-card company logging greater earnings and revenue for the fourth quarter, boosted by strong spending trends.

* Shares of Block fell 1.6% in premarket trading, after a Bloomberg report said Apple is planning a service that will let retailers accept payments on iPhones without the need for extra hardware.

* Sherwin-Williams shares declined 3% premarket after the paint company reported a fourth-quarter earnings miss and full-year earnings guidance below Street expectations.

* Earnings are due after the market close from Apple, Robinhood Markets, Mondelez International and Visa.

Chart of the Day

* Give priority to sustainability, however, and investors will be left in a difficult position: assuming the shift away from fossil fuels happens, they have the choice of making a difference, or making more profit.

Write to Caitlin Ostroff at caitlin.ostroff@wsj.com

Apple, Intel, Tesla, Levi Strauss: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
